channel.title: Anka Design Studio
channel.description: Recent content on Anka Design Studio

item.title: The Perfect Outfit...for my Window!
item.description: When it comes to window furnishings, curtains really know how to transform a room….in a good way! Some of you may have horrible memories of lacey sheers paired with floral yellow and brown drapes at your Nanna’s shabby chic house but let me assure you… that ship has sailed!

item.title: Vermont
item.description: Build completed by DSBuilt. Photography by Daniela Fulford Photography. Interior design by Anka Design Studio.

item.title: Brighton
item.description: Build completed by DSBuilt. Photography by Daniela Fulford Photography. Interior design by Anka Design Studio.

item.title: Ashburton
item.description: This 1920s Californian bungalow in the heart of Ashburton was completely transformed into a beautiful grand home with each area serving a purpose. A minimalistic design ensured the Carrara marble and ravine joinery were the standout heroes while re-instating the character of the home by keeping the dental cornicing, original lead-light windows and whitewashed original hardwood flooring.

item.title: Albert Park
item.description: This beachside apartment was in need of some brightening as the original chocolate joinery and black marble stone seemed to be much too dark and clashed with the original brunette polished stone tundra flooring and the water front views.

item.title: Narre Warren
item.description: This 1980s suburban home was last renovated in 2005, however after 16 years the peachy dolphin tiles and orange floorboards definitely needed an upgrade, not to mention all the discoloured chrome tap wear and dated joinery throughout.
